name: Ginger-Scallion Ramen Noodles
author: lutzflcat
summary: This quick, easy, and budget-friendly dish will bring some well-deserved respect to humble ramen. Feel free to add shrimp or leftover chicken, if desired. This will serve 6 as a side dish or 4 as a main course. Garnish with additional sliced scallions or chopped peanuts, if desired.
ingredients: 1 tablespoon peeled and minced fresh ginger
2 (3 ounce) packages ramen noodles, without flavor packets
directions: Whisk soy sauce, chicken broth, rice vinegar, cornstarch, ginger, honey, and garlic together in a small bowl; set aside
Bring a pot of lightly salted water to a boil
Cook ramen noodles in the boiling water, stirring occasionally, until tender, about 3 minutes
Drain, reserving 1 cup of cooking water
Heat sesame oil in a large skillet or wok over medium heat
Add scallions and carrots to the hot skillet and quickly stir-fry until soft, about 1 minute
Reduce heat to medium-low, pour in sauce, and cook until sauce starts to thicken, about 2 minutes
Stir in drained ramen noodles, separating and tossing them with tongs until coated
Add reserved cooking water a little at a time until you reach your desired consistency
